title: Taiwan and China's Big Disagreement
summary: This article talks about Taiwan and China not getting along. Taiwan is a place with 23 million people that rules itself, but China says Taiwan is part of it. Taiwan's deputy foreign minister, Chen Ming-chi, spoke with a reporter. He said that China cannot live peacefully with democracies like Taiwan. He also mentioned that Taiwan supports Ukraine because Ukraine is fighting a bigger neighbor, just like Taiwan worries about China. The article explains that leaders from the U.S. and China talked about Taiwan. It's important to understand that Taiwan wants to be independent and safe.

background_read: Taiwan is an island in Asia that has its own government and elections, but China claims it as part of its country. This has caused arguments for many years. Democracies are countries where people can vote for their leaders, like Taiwan and the U.S. Sometimes, bigger countries try to control smaller ones, which is why Taiwan is concerned about China. Understanding this helps see why Taiwan supports Ukraine, which is fighting Russia, another big neighbor.
